title: In which year in the 1930s was the economy the strongest? - Quora

response.answer_text: 1936 or 1939. In 1936, New Deal programs had raised GDP and employment levels. Than conservatives tried to push FDR to balance the budget. This was a cardinal mistake. This pressure resulted in another recession in 1937. FDR realized the mistake though and quickly resumed deficit spending. By 1939 recovery was again occurring and this would be bolstered by defense spending here and abroad as the situation in Europe broke into open warfare after the German attack on Poland in 1939.

Undoubtedly 1939, just prior to WWII, as economic reforms were having an effect. Most countries were beginning to recover from the depression although the stock markets didn’t reach their 1929 highs until the middle 1950s.
